title: Simulation Education Based on Social Interaction to Strengthen Scientific Argumentation Competencies

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental scientific knowledge and discussion skills
context.additional_context: Focuses on developing competencies for prospective and current teachers to experience scientific argumentation processes and apply them to actual lesson design

learning_goals: Learners can conduct three or more discussions using core elements of scientific argumentation (claim, evidence, rebuttal) in VR simulation environments.
Learners can document in two or more formats the process of identifying logical fallacies in peers' scientific arguments and providing constructive feedback.
Learners can submit project-based scientific argumentation lesson designs following a social interaction-based learning framework.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
